intro: Cereus yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan torch cactus, is a species of cactus native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with a tall, spiny stem that can grow up to 6 meters in height. Its flowers are large, white, and fragrant, appearing at the tips of the stems during the night. The plant is adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun with well-draining soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in hot, dry climates.
